column5: LONDON  Sept 24 Olympic sprint champion Usain Bolt will earn an estimated $10 million a year in a sponsorship deal with German sportswear company Puma that will take him to the end of his career.

column4: India's Tata Motors unit to stop production at Spanish plant
column5: NEW DELHI  Sept 24 A unit of India's Tata Motors Ltd said it will stop making vehicles at a Spanish plant from next month because of mounting losses and no signs of a turnaround in muted demand in the near future.

column4: UPDATE 1-Argentina says antitrust agency to study Telefonica deal
column5: BUENOS AIRES  Sept 24 Argentina's antitrust regulator will study a proposal by Spanish-owned Telefonica  to gain control of Telecom Italia  both of which operate in the South American country  the government said on Tuesday.

column4: Telefonica to increase hold over Telecom Italia
column5: MILAN Spanish telecoms group Telefonica  has struck a deal to gradually secure control of Telecom Italia  and its lucrative south American business without having to launch a full takeover bid.

column4: Brazil regulator could demand sale of TIM Participacoes: source
column5: BRASILIA Brazil's telecom regulator Anatel would demand that Telecom Italia sell its Brazilian mobile operator affiliate TIM Participacoes if Spanish group Telefonica SA acquired 100 pct of Telco  the controlling shareholder in Telecom Italia  a source at Anatel told Reuters on Tuesday.

column4: Now not the time for deeper austerity in Russia: Finance Minister
column5: MOSCOW Russia's government should avoid deeper austerity measures at a time of slowing economic growth  Finance Minister Anton Siluanov told the Reuters Russia Investment Summit on Tuesday.

column4: Russian Finance Ministry to buy foreign exchange in 2013 to replenish rainy-day fund
column5: MOSCOW The Finance Ministry plans to buy foreign exchange to top up its budget Reserve Fund this year  Finance Minister Anton Siluanov told the Reuters Russia Investment Summit on Tuesday.

column4: U.S. home prices up  but slip in confidence could be a concern
column5: NEW YORK U.S. home prices slowed their rate of gains in July and a dip in consumer confidence this month underscored the potential for higher borrowing costs and a sluggish economy to dent a housing market recovery.

column4: Panasonic Automotive executive indicted for price-fixing
column5: WASHINGTON An executive with Panasonic Automotive Systems Corp was indicted on Tuesday on charges that he conspired to fix the prices of steering wheel switches and other parts sold to Toyota Motor Corp  for cars sold in the United States  the Justice Department said.

column4: Wells Fargo fails to end U.S. mortgage fraud lawsuit

column4: Wells Fargo fails to win dismissal of U.S. mortgage fraud case
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 24 A federal judge rejected Wells Fargo & Co's bid to dismiss a lawsuit accusing the largest U.S. mortgage lender of defrauding the government by lying about the quality of mortgages it submitted for insurance coverage.
